subject: Re: Email and DNS for prime

full_threads.body: hey team closing this for our sla

Hi Andrew,

Hope you are doing great!

Looking in for Joel—yes, we confirm that it's all good to remove the DNS references for Cogramail.

Furthermore, feel free to reach out if you have any other questions—we’re always happy to help.

Hi Joel,

Now that we have everything working for the email system using the kogarahmail.primeanaesthetics.au as the sending subdomain I will remove the DNS references for cogramail... etc seeing as we will not be using them. I would like to keep the DNS as tidy as possible. Is that ok?

Thanks
Andrew Guy
@joy Just gonna put this in pending.

Hi Joel,

Thanks. The to and from addresses are correct.

Also passes our the DMARC tests so it all looks good on my end.

Thanks again for the time and assistance.

Once we get the final go live approval I will be in contact again for the DNS settings for the actual website too.

Regards,
Andrew Guy

Hi Andrew,

Thanks for updating the DNS.

The DNS has been verified, we have resent the email to the following:
  • Contact Form → contactus@primeanaesthetics.au
  • Surgeon Form → cover@primeanaesthetics.au
  • Estimate Form → estimate@primeanaesthetics.au

For your convenience, here are some quick links:
https://primeanaesthetics.kinsta.cloud/contact-us/
https://primeanaesthetics.kinsta.cloud/for-our-surgeons/
https://primeanaesthetics.kinsta.cloud/fee-estimate/

Let me know if this works for you.

Dear Joel,

Looking good from my end now. Let me know when the DNS entries verify and then we can switch over and test.

Andrew

Hi Andrew,

Thanks so much for your careful review and for spotting that — I’ve updated the subdomain spelling so everything will now use: kogarahmail.primeanaesthetics.au

Here are the final DNS records to add:

SPF (TXT Record)

Paste the following value in your domain's current SPF record. This will merge MailerSend value with any pre-existing SPF record values. If you don't already have an SPF record, then create a new TXT record for primeanaesthetics.au  with this value:
Host/Name: primeanaesthetics.au
Value:v=spf1 include:_spf.mailersend.net include:_spf.google.com include:amazonses.com ip4:203.129.21.2 ~all

DKIM (CNAME Record)

Host/Name: mlsend2._domainkey.primeanaesthetics.au
Value:mlsend2._domainkey.mailersend.net

Return-Path (CNAME Record)

Host/Name: kogarahmail.primeanaesthetics.au
Value:mailersend.net
Once these records are added and have had a little time to propagate, I’ll verify them in MailerSend and switch everything over.

At that point, all forms will be sending From: noreply@primeanaesthetics.au (or another address you prefer).

Confirming the forms has been updated, the messages will route to:
  • Contact Form → contactus@primeanaesthetics.au
  • Surgeon Form → cover@primeanaesthetics.au
  • Estimate Form → estimate@primeanaesthetics.au

This will give you a much cleaner “From” address, keep everything branded as Prime Anaesthetics, and ensure the emails are fully authenticated (SPF, DKIM, DMARC).

Just let me know once the records are in place, and I’ll take care of the rest.

Dear Joel,

Thank you very much for your patience in setting this up.

One last change please. Can we change the spelling of the latest subdomain from kograahmail to kogarahmail (the a and h swap) so the full domain for the mail-by header will be kogarahmail.primeanaesthetics.au

I will wait for your confirmation until I enter those DNS entries.

Once verified the details for the to and from address are to be as below:

From Address
All Forms- noreply@primeanaesthetics.au

To Addresses - different for each form
https://primeanaesthetics.kinsta.cloud/contact-us/     -     contactus@primeanaesthetics.au

https://primeanaesthetics.kinsta.cloud/for-our-surgeons/ -    cover@primeanaesthetics.au

https://primeanaesthetics.kinsta.cloud/fee-estimate/    -    estimate@primeanaesthetics.au

Thanks again
Andrew Guy

Hi Andrew,

Thank you for the feedback and for sharing the email header examples — that’s very helpful.

You’re absolutely right: while our current setup using the cogramail.primeanaesthetics.au subdomain is fully functional and DMARC compliant, we can improve it by configuring MailerSend to send directly from the main domain (e.g. noreply@primeanaesthetics.au ). This will make the “From” address cleaner and ensure better brand consistency, while still passing SPF, DKIM, and DMARC checks.

To achieve this, we will need to add a new set of DNS records that MailerSend provides specifically for the root domain (primeanaesthetics.au ). Once those are published and verified, we can switch the sender address from noreply@cogramail.primeanaesthetics.au to noreply@primeanaesthetics.au .

This will also change the mailed-by header to: kograahmail.primeanaesthetics.au .
This will also change the From address to: noreply@primeanaesthetics.au (or another address of your choice under the main domain).

Here are the DNS records to add:

SPF (TXT Record)

Paste the following value in your domain's current SPF record. This will merge MailerSend value with any pre-existing SPF record values. If you don't already have an SPF record, then create a new TXT record for primeanaesthetics.au with this value:
Host/Name: primeanaesthetics.au
Value:v=spf1 include:_spf.mailersend.net include:_spf.google.com include:amazonses.com ip4:203.129.21.2 ~all

DKIM (CNAME Record)

Host/Name: mlsend2._domainkey.primeanaesthetics.au
Value: mlsend2._domainkey.mailersend.net

Return-Path (CNAME Record)

Host/Name: kograahmail.primeanaesthetics.au
Value:mailersend.net

Once these records are in place and have propagated, I’ll verify them in MailerSend and update the mailer settings so emails will be sent from noreply@primeanaesthetics.au .

Dear Joel.

Thank you for your followup email.

The setup you have works but it could actaully be better.

You have setup the address that it's send from using the subdomain we setup. You can however setup so that the email comes from the main domain "noreply@primeanaesthetics.au" instead of "noreply@cogramail.primeanaesthetics.au"

I've attached your email as well as another non Google email that we have setup which is sent from Amazon SeS so you can see how the are different. In addition could you also change the friendly name to Prime Anaesthetics ( both capital?). I have also included the full header detail for the amazon sent email so you can see exactly what domains are signing where.

Hi Andrew,

Thank you for your patience.

We’ve now verified the DNS records and everything is set up correctly. I’ve attached a screenshot showing the results I received.

We’ve also re-sent the email to office@primeanaesthetics.au, so it should be coming through smoothly this time.

For your convenience, here are some quick links:
https://primeanaesthetics.kinsta.cloud/contact-us/
https://primeanaesthetics.kinsta.cloud/for-our-surgeons/
https://primeanaesthetics.kinsta.cloud/fee-estimate/

Thanks again for your support in getting this sorted — it’s much appreciated.

Dear Joel,

Likewise thank you for your time on the phone.

Please let me know when the SPF record verifies. I have checked it on mxtoolbox and it looks good there so hopefully it verifies soon.

Then once you have sent some test emails I can check that it all passes DMARC.

Please note that we have three forms on the website that are sending emails to use.

The contact us and the request an anaesthetist form are currently set to send from "noreply@primeanesthetics.au" an they send to their correct email addresses so they both look good and should be good once the "from header" is set to cogramail.primeanaesthetics.au as the domain.

The other form on the website is the fee estimate form. That is still sending from "support@wolfiq.com.au" and is sending to estimate@primeanaesthetics as well as "office@primeanaesthetics.au". That one needs to be changed to send from "noreply@primeanaesthetics.au" and only send to "estimate@primeanaesthetics.au" as well as have the from header set to cogramail.primeanaesthetics.au as the domain.

We can test all three after the spf settings are verified.

Andrew Guy

Hi Andrew,

Thank you for your time earlier today.

The DNS records are still in the process of propagating.

Once they’ve been verified, we’ll complete testing on the forms and then send them through for your review.
Hi Andrew,

Hi Andrew,

SPF (TXT Record)

Host/Name: cogramail.primeanaesthetics.au
Value:
v=spf1 include:_spf.mailersend.net ~all

DKIM (CNAME Record)

Host/Name: mlsend2._domainkey.cogramail.primeanaesthetics.au
Value:
mlsend2._domainkey.mailersend.net

Return-Path (CNAME Record)

Host/Name: mta.cogramail.primeanaesthetics.au
Value:
mailersend.net

Hi Andrew,

1. SPF Record (TXT)

If you don’t already have an SPF record, create a new TXT record with this value:
v=spf1 include:_spf.mailersend.net include:_spf.google.com include:amazonses.com ip4:203.129.21.2 ~all
If you already have an SPF record, update it to merge the above value (you can only have one SPF record).

2. DKIM Record (CNAME)

Create a CNAME record:
  • Host/Name: mlsend2._domainkey
  • Value/Points to: mlsend2._domainkey.mailersend.net

3. Return-Path (CNAME)

Create another CNAME record:
  • Host/Name: mta
  • Value/Points to: mailersend.net

Hi Andrew,

Sure, here is my number 0480 041 691.

Hi Joel.

Would it possible to speak on the phone about the email setup ?

Andrew

Hi Andrew,

Thank you so much for following up — really appreciate it!

We’re making good progress on the site updates, and as soon as we have the client’s confirmation, we’ll send through the DNS records for primeanaesthetics.au.

On the email side, do you have a preferred “from address” you’d like us to use? To ensure everything passes DMARC compliance smoothly, we usually set this up through Mailersend (and will provide the DNS records for you to update as well). That said, if you’d prefer another option, we’re more than happy to work with that too.

Once we have your preference, we’ll get everything set up so it all runs seamlessly.

Dear All. ,

Can I please have someone contact me about this ?

We are keen to get it alll setup and finalised so we can go live.

Andrew.

Thank you

How and when shall I hear from the senior dev to discuss those things with ?

Regards
Andrew
